title.rendered: A Guide to Targeted Express Entry for Farming Professionals

[vc_column_text]“Can I immigrate to Canada as a Farming Professional with Targeted Express Entry?”

Absolutely! It is indeed possible to immigrate to Canada as a Farming Professional through the Targeted Express Entry program. The Canadian government recognizes the vital role of farming professionals in the agricultural sector and has included specific occupations in the Targeted Occupations List for this field.

The Targeted Express Entry Draws for Farming Professionals present a valuable opportunity for eligible candidates to obtain Canada PR Visa. This comprehensive guide aims to provide vital information for farming professionals interested in making a move to Canada through Targeted Express Entry.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

Understanding Targeted Express Entry Category-Based Rounds

In the category-based express entry draws, candidates are selected based on specific criteria established by the Minister to achieve economic goals. These criteria include language proficiency in either English or French, relevant work experience in specific Training, Education, Experience, and Responsibilities (TEER) categories of the National Occupational Classification (NOC Version 2021), and educational qualifications.

These draws have the purpose of extending invitations to potential applicants possessing the most highly sought-after skills, encouraging them to submit applications for permanent residency in Canada.

To inaugurate this thrilling undertaking, the initial targeted Express Entry draw took place on July 28, 2023. During this draw, a total of 500 candidates from the Healthcare category were selected for invitation to apply. Notably, this category is one among the six categories enumerated below:

  • French-language proficiency
  • Healthcare occupations
  • Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math (STEM) occupations
  • Trade occupations
  • Transport occupations
  • Agriculture and agri-food occupations

https://www.elaarimmigration.ca/news/canada-targeted-express-entry-draw-august-2023/[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

Targeted Express Entry for Farming Professionals

In the category-based rounds of invitations, candidates in farming occupations, including farming professionals, are selected based on specific criteria established by the Minister to fulfill economic objectives. Candidates must also fulfill the requirements of one of the three economic immigration programs: the Federal Skilled Worker Program, the Canadian Experience Class, or the Federal Skilled Trades Program.

Which Farming Professionals are Eligible for Targeted Express Entry Draw?

While there are various occupations within the farming sector, the Targeted Express Entry List focuses specifically on farming professionals. Candidates applying under this category must have accumulated at least 6 months of continuous work experience within the past 3 years in a single occupation listed below.

Occupation 2021 NOC Code Work Experience Requirement
Contractors and supervisors, landscaping, grounds 82031 At least 6 months of continuous work experience within
maintenance, and horticulture services the past 3 years in the same occupation
Agricultural service contractors and farm supervisors 82030 At least 6 months of continuous work experience within
the past 3 years in the same occupation

Pro Tip: Seek the assistance of experienced immigration experts or refer to the official website for an accurate NOC Code, as you might be eligible for the Targeted Express Entry.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” top_padding=”5%” bottom_padding=”5%” text_align=”left”][vc_column_inner column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/2″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][image_with_animation image_url=”14454″ animation=”None” hover_animation=”none” alignment=”” border_radius=”none” box_shadow=”none” image_loading=”default” max_width=”100%” max_width_mobile=”default”][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner column_padding=”padding-6-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/2″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”1px” column_border_color=”#707070″ column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text]

Prepare for Targeted Express Entry with ELAAR!

[/vc_column_text][nectar_btn size=”large” button_style=”regular” button_color_2=”Accent-Color” icon_family=”default_arrow” text=”Let’s Talk” url=”https://www.elaarimmigration.ca/contact-us/” margin_top=”20px”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text]

How to Apply for Targeted Express Entry as a Farming Professional?

To apply for the Targeted Express Entry as a farming professional, follow these steps:

Determine your Eligibility:  Ensure that you meet the eligibility criteria for the farming professionals category. This includes having at least 6 months of continuous work experience in a single occupation listed in the Targeted Occupations List for farming professionals, along with meeting other eligibility requirements from one of the three federal immigration programs.

Language Proficiency: Take the necessary language tests to demonstrate your proficiency in English or French. The accepted language tests for Express Entry include the IELTS (International English Language Testing System) for English and the TEF (Test d’évaluation de français) or TCF (Test de Connaissance du Français) for French.

Create an Express Entry Profile: Create an online Express Entry profile through the official Canadian government website. Provide accurate and up-to-date information about your education, work experience, language proficiency, and other relevant details. Your profile will be assessed based on the Comprehensive Ranking System (CRS), which awards points for various factors.

Increase Your CRS Score: Enhance your CRS score by maximizing points in areas such as language proficiency, education, work experience, and additional factors like Canadian education or work experience, Provincial Nominee Program, or a valid job offer. Seek professional guidance, if needed, to optimize your profile and improve your chances of receiving an Invitation to Apply (ITA).

Targeted Express Entry Draw: Receive an invitation to apply in a Targeted Express Entry Draw for Farming professionals. An ITA is required to apply for permanent residency under the Express Entry program.

Submitting an Application: Regularly monitor the Express Entry draws and check if your occupation is being targeted. If you receive an ITA, you will have a specified time frame to submit a complete application for permanent residency. Ensure that you compile all the required documents accurately and submit them within the given timeframe.

Medical Examinations and Security Checks: After submitting your application, you may be required to undergo a medical examination to ensure you meet the health requirements for immigration. Additionally, security checks will be conducted as part of the application process.

Application Processing: Once your application is submitted, it will be processed by the relevant immigration authorities. The processing time may vary, and you can track the status of your application online.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” top_padding=”5%” bottom_padding=”5%” text_align=”left”][vc_column_inner column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/2″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][image_with_animation image_url=”14455″ animation=”None” hover_animation=”none” alignment=”” border_radius=”none” box_shadow=”none” image_loading=”default” max_width=”100%” max_width_mobile=”default”][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner column_padding=”padding-6-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/2″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”1px” column_border_color=”#707070″ column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text]

How Does ELAAR Immigration Help Farming Professionals?

ELAAR Immigration specializes in providing comprehensive support and guidance to farming professionals aiming to navigate the Targeted Express Entry process. Our team of experts understands the unique needs and requirements of farming professionals in the Canadian agricultural system and is committed to maximizing your chances of receiving an Invitation to Apply (ITA) as a farming professional.

We will assist you in assessing your eligibility, analyzing your Express Entry profile, and identifying areas that can be strengthened to enhance your CRS (Comprehensive Ranking System) score. Our experienced consultants will guide you through the optimization of your work experience, educational background, and other factors to ensure your profile aligns with the specific requirements of the Targeted Express Entry Draw for farming professionals.

For a limited time, eligible farming professionals can sign up with us for as low as CAD $999 to benefit from our comprehensive services, including:

  • Submission of a complete and accurate Express Entry profile and/or PNP Expression of Interest
  • Support with preparing documents in advance in anticipation of receiving an ITA
  • One-on-one ZOOM appointment with an RCIC to discuss your personalized case
  • On-going support from an RCIC throughout the process and even after

Contact us today to benefit from our expertise and personalized assistance. excerpt.rendered: Explore the opportunities and benefits of Targeted Express Entry for farming professionals in Canada. Discover how this program facilitates permanent residency, with insights into the 2023 draws and application process.
